norse_words.meaning: Realm of the Æsir gods
Rainbow bridge connecting Midgard and Asgard
World Tree connecting all realms
Thor's hammer, a symbol of protection and power
Prophesied end of the world and rebirth
Giant, often in opposition to the gods
Chooser of the slain, serving Odin
Dragon gnawing at the roots of Yggdrasil
Great winter preceding Ragnarök
Wise being guarding the well of wisdom
Horn sounded by Heimdallr at Ragnarök
Gigantic wolf, bound by the gods
Trickster god and shapeshifter
Odin's eight-legged horse
Primordial void before creation
Realm of the dead and its ruler
Ship of the gods, always with a favorable wind
Fire giant who leads destruction during Ragnarök
Sacred symbols used for writing and magic
Goddess of love, beauty, and fertility
All-Father, god of wisdom, war, and death
God of thunder and protector of Midgard
Realm of humans
Realm of the dark elves or dwarves
Realm of the Vanir gods
Realm of the light elves
Realm of fire and heat
Realm of ice and cold
Warriors chosen by Valkyries to fight in Odin's army
Odin's wife, associated with marriage and motherhood
God of light, purity, and beauty
God of war and law
Watchman of the gods, who guards Bifröst
The Midgard Serpent, encircling the world
One of Odin’s ravens, representing thought
One of Odin’s ravens, representing memory
Odin’s magical gold ring that replicates itself
Odin’s spear that always hits its mark
Battlefield of Ragnarök
Sacrifices made to the elves
Stallion used by the builder of Asgard's walls
Horse of Nótt (night)
Sacrificial ritual
Norse magic associated with prophecy and fate
Poet or bard of Norse society
Assembly or council in Norse governance
Spirits or beings of nature
Rune, used for writing and divination

elemental_words.meaning: Fire symbolizes energy, transformation, passion, and the dual forces of creation and destruction.
Water symbolizes emotion, adaptability, intuition, and the flow of life and renewal.
Earth symbolizes grounding, stability, nourishment, and the connection to the natural world.
Air symbolizes communication, expansion, freedom, and the breath of life.
Spirit symbolizes the essence of life, the soul, and the connection to the divine.
Mind symbolizes the intellect, consciousness, and the power of thought.
Heart symbolizes love, compassion, empathy, and the center of emotions.
Will symbolizes determination, purpose, and the power to make choices.
Body symbolizes the physical form, health, vitality, and the embodiment of life.
Soul symbolizes the essence of an individual, the core of one's being, and the connection to the spiritual realm.

weapon_words.meaning: A sharp blade used for cutting or thrusting.
A heavy, two-handed weapon used for chopping or splitting.
A long, pointed weapon used for thrusting or throwing.
A ranged weapon consisting of a flexible stick with a string and arrow.
A defensive weapon used to block or deflect attacks.
A type of sword with a curved blade and a short handle.
A heavy, club-like weapon used for striking or crushing.
A polearm with a long, curved blade attached to a shaft.
A long, curved sword with a long handle.
A large, two-handed axe with a curved blade.

armour_words.meaning: Typically conical, made of iron, sometimes with a nose guard.
Interlocking metal rings worn as body armor.
Armor made from small iron or leather plates tied together.
Light, flexible armor used for mobility.
Armguards made from leather or metal.
Often used for warmth, occasionally reinforced with leather.
The metal center of a shield, used for deflecting blows.
